definition: to turn over (when lying)/(fig.) to free oneself/to emancipate oneself/to bring about a change of one's fortunes
variant of 翻[fan1]
to turn over/to flip over/to overturn/to rummage through/to translate/to decode/to double/to climb over or into/to cross
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
to work hard towards a turnaround/to fight to reverse sth
(Tw) (coll.) earthquake (According to a folk tale, earthquakes are caused by the occasional movements of an ox that lives under the earth.)
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune

sentences.english: Use rollovers to submit or reset a form.
sentences.chinese: 使用翻身递交或者重新设置一张表格。

sentences.english: It is difficult to turn over in a hammock.
Abduction stabilizer bar between legs is never used as a handle to turn the child.
sentences.chinese: 千万不能用两腿之间保持外展的支持棒给小儿翻身。

sentences.english: Have client practice turning and sitting up.
The opportunity for Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac to recover has gone.
sentences.chinese: “两房”想咸鱼翻身的机会已经没有了。

sentences.english: Liberated farmers measure the field during the land reform in northeast China in 1948.
sentences.chinese: 1948年，东北土地改革中，翻身农民在丈量土地。

sentences.english: A few days later, I was in urine emergency too, so I jumped up the bed and walked to the washroom.
sentences.chinese: 后来有一次我也突然尿急，我翻身起床去卫生间。

sentences.english: Robots can do housework, cooking, washing clothes, rolled over and feed the drug.
sentences.chinese: 机器人可以做家务，烧饭，洗衣服，翻身，喂药。

sentences.english: For the poor people not always be poor, be bullied, and be slaved.
sentences.chinese: 只为穷人要翻身哪，不受欺负喂，不做牛和羊。

sentences.english: Fanshen is also an unchallengeable classic.
sentences.chinese: 《翻身》也不容置疑是一部经典著作。

sentences.english: What, babe, what you hear in the bed does not stop turning?
sentences.chinese: 怎么了，贝贝，怎么听到你在床上不停的翻身啊？

sentences.english: Rapidly, Zhou Yu managed to rein back, but he was shot in the left rib and fell to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 周瑜急勒马回时，被一弩箭，正射中左肋，翻身落马。

sentences.english: If you think they're just going to roll over - you've got another thing coming. " - Kobe Bryant."
sentences.chinese: 如果你认为他们只是想翻身，那么将有你好受的。

sentences.english: Right away, then obviously my company turned around.
sentences.chinese: 我的公司当即就翻身了。

sentences.english: Can Mr Brown reverse the dynamics?
It would be a mistake, however, to think that Mr McCain will be static for ever.
sentences.chinese: 然而认为麦肯恩永无翻身，这就错了。

definition: to jump up suddenly/to bound up/to rise up in one bound
to get on a horse/to mount
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
to stand up
to reverse/to turn around (an undesirable situation)/(mechanics) torsion
from now on/in the future/time to come
heel
to take advantage/to seize an opportunity/in passing/without taking extra trouble/conveniently
powerful/vigorous/pungent/towards/in view of
thoroughfare/to go straight ahead/to rush/to clash
(of water) to dash against/to mix with water/to infuse/to rinse/to flush/to develop (a film)/to rise in the air/to clash/to collide with
luckily/fortunately
to get up/to leave/to set forth
to take advantage of a favorable situation/to seize an opportunity
to get up on hind legs (esp. of horse)/to stand/to spring up
to gasp for breath/to take a breather
to stand firm
to go down to the fields/to get up from bed/to leave one's sickbed/to be born
